items.headline: U.S. Stocks Retreat Amid Private Credit Concerns, Geopolitical Tensions, and Mixed Economic Data
items.summary: U.S. stock markets closed lower today, reversing recent gains as investors reacted to concerns regarding private credit providers and ongoing geopolitical tensions between the United States and Iran. Mixed economic data, including slower-than-expected GDP growth and elevated inflation, also weighed on sentiment, leading to a 'risk-off' environment.

items.headline: Deere & Co. ($DE) Surges on Strong Outlook
items.summary: Deere & Co. ($DE) jumped 11.6% after raising its full-year profit outlook, signaling robust performance ahead.

items.headline: Etsy Inc. ($ETSY) Climbs on Q4 Earnings Beat
items.summary: Etsy Inc. ($ETSY) climbed 9.3% after reporting stronger-than-expected adjusted earnings for the fourth quarter of 2025.

items.headline: EPAM Systems ($EPAM) Tumbles on Cautious Guidance
items.summary: EPAM Systems ($EPAM) slumped 17% today after issuing cautious guidance for the upcoming period, disappointing investors.

items.headline: Akamai Technologies ($AKAM) Drops on Weak Profit Forecast
items.summary: Akamai Technologies ($AKAM) saw a 10.2% decline after its profit forecast for the upcoming year fell short of analyst estimates.

items.headline: U.S. GDP Growth Slows, Inflation Accelerates in Q4 2025
items.summary: The U.S. economy's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) increased at a slower-than-expected 1.4% annual rate in the fourth quarter of 2025, down significantly from 4.4% in the third quarter. This slowdown was attributed to a downturn in government and consumer spending. Simultaneously, the Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) price index rose 2.9% year-over-year in December, with core PCE hitting 3.0%, surpassing the Federal Reserve's 2% target.

items.headline: Fed Minutes Hint at Potential Rate Hikes Amid Persistent Inflation
items.summary: Minutes from the Federal Reserve's January meeting, released this week, revealed that several officials discussed the possibility of raising interest rates if inflation remains above the target level. This hawkish sentiment comes despite extended forecasts for rate cuts potentially capping gains across U.S. indices.

items.headline: Significant Sector Rotation Underway Towards 'Real Economy' Stocks
items.summary: A notable sector rotation is continuing, with industrial, consumer defensive, and energy stocks leading the market higher. These 'real economy' sectors are outperforming technology, communication services, consumer cyclicals, and financials, as investors look beyond AI-driven returns for stability and growth. The Energy Select Sector SPDR (XLE) rose 1.9%, and the Technology Select Sector SPDR (XLK) rose 1%. Conversely, the Utilities Select Sector SPDR (XLU) fell 1.7%, and Real Estate Select Sector SPDR (XLRE) fell 1.3%.

items.headline: U.S.-Iran Tensions Drive Oil to Six-Month High
items.summary: Geopolitical tensions between the United States and Iran have intensified, pushing Brent crude oil towards $72 a barrel, marking a six-month high. This rise in oil prices contributes to inflation concerns and adds to the risk-off sentiment in the markets.

items.headline: Supreme Court Strikes Down Trump-Era Tariffs
items.summary: The U.S. Supreme Court struck down President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, which had previously caused market panic. This decision is expected to reduce the overall average effective tariff rate for consumers.
